tooltips.tooltip: Deletes or preserves an object depending on wether the size of the chunk is larger or smaller than the given threshold.
Deletes or preserves an object in relation to wether a door position is used.
Enables the user to create and edit door positions. Only used with the chunk object, don't add this manually.
Chooses on of several prefabs to be created at the object's position at runtime.
Procedurally creates a mesh (e.g. cube, terrain, cylinder). Mesh can be transformed by AbstractBounds.
Generates the room mesh from the size defined in AbstractBounds. Only used with the chunk object, don't add this manually.
Copies an object several times along an axis defined by the user.
Copies an object and randomly positions the copies within the given area.
Used to define dynamic and static tags. Tags can be used to define constraints in the LevelGeneratorWindow. Only used with the chunk object, don't add this manually.
Gives an abstract, non-final and random size to another abstract component. Can be used with arrays and meshes.
Randomly positions an object along one axis inside of an user-defined interval. Can be used multiple times on the same object.
Randomly rotates an object along the given axes. Angle can be rounded.
Randomly scales an object between a given interval.
Docks and object to one of 27 anchor points of the AbstractBounds component nearest in the hierarchy. This enables the use of relative positioning.
Shoots a raycast into the specified direction. The object will stick to where the raycast collided with another object.
Enables you to randomize any given variable of any component of the same object. Supported types are float, int, color, vector3 and vector2.
